## Acceptance Criteria
<!-- Define what "documented" looks like -->
- [ ] Documentation is clear and accurate
- [ ] Code examples are included (if applicable)
- [ ] Links to related documentation are added
- [ ] Documentation is in the right location
- [ ] 

## Target Audience
<!-- Who will read this documentation? -->
- [ ] End users (using the framework)
- [ ] Developers (contributing to the framework)
- [ ] System administrators (deploying the framework)
- [ ] GitHub Copilot (helping with future tasks)

## Documentation Type
<!-- What kind of documentation is this? -->
- [ ] README update
- [ ] API documentation
- [ ] Tutorial / How-to guide
- [ ] Architecture documentation (`docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`)
- [ ] Troubleshooting guide
- [ ] Code comments
- [ ] Other: 

## Affected Files
<!-- List the files that will be created or updated -->
- `docs/`
- `README.md`

## Related Code
<!-- Are there code changes associated with this documentation? -->
- [ ] Documentation only (no code changes)
- [ ] Documenting new feature (code already exists)
- [ ] Documenting planned feature (code will be added)
